Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearlan
Reviews.Content: Its a typical Best western hotel.I had a single room very clean and with free wi-fi .The staff are helpful the breakfast was ok.It's right next to the U-bahn but it's not central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: brucetupholme
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel for 3 years now for the annual World Money Fair in the nearby Estrel Convention Center . It is ideally located for this near Alexanderplatz . Rooms are very comfortable , warm . Would help to have a room safe and some clothing cupboards that close but apart from that cannot fault it . Excellent breakfast is included in the room rate and again there is free WIFI which I look for in hotels for my business . Very pleasant and helpful staff .

Reviews.Title: “Fine if your expectations aren't too high.”
Reviews.Author: Merz45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in January 2012. Yes, it's noisy, as others have mentioned, and if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs. Otherwise a good location: U-bahn station round the corner and a bus stop right outside - and the bus takes you straight to the main station via Potsdamer Platz. Very handy. Breakfast OK (no bacon though), room pleasant and clean, staff friendly (note that the guy at reception also has to act as barman), free wifi; in short, if you just need somewhere to sleep while you're out in Berlin all day, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wvtravelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a R&R trip around Europe (Jan 2010). We were able to drop our bags and park in a garage just down the street. The hotel was clean and easy on the buget. The breakfast area is on the top floor and offers a nice view of the surrounding area and the food was pleasant as well. We were able to walk to walk a short distace to the metro train station and were quickly in the city center where we took a hop on/off bus tour. If your looking for a nice Budget hotel this is it. Oh and the drain is on the bathroom floor for a reason, so don't put anything on the floor you don't want wet. but nothing a towel on the floor won't fix.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a decent price”
Reviews.Author: rlro
Reviews.Content: Good location (although not excellent): a stone's throw from a subway station, but not in a walkable distance from any major attraction. The room was spacious and comfortable and the breakfast was very good. Free wi-fi Internet in the rooms. The cons: the hotel is located in an intersection between two important streets, so the traffic noise is considerable. The TV set in the room was very small and outdated (CRT).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel next to a busy square”
Reviews.Author: badeendje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the corner of two very busy streets, which means that most rooms suffer from a lot of traffic noise throughout the night. This includes car horns and sirens of emergency services, which will probably wake you up a few times (though we slept ok after a busy day of sightseeing). However, the Hermannplatz U-bahn stop is right around the corner, which is very convenient, and we were generally not bothered by noise from other guests. The area doesn’t have many restaurants or bars, but be sure to ask for a map with recommendations at reception because there are some within walking distance. Our room had a double bed, two chairs, a small desk, a very small television and a luggage area next to the door (big enough to store and unpack a small suitcase). It had air-conditioning and free Wi-Fi, though to access this you need to get a 24-hour access code at the reception desk (and you don’t get access codes for every day of your stay at check-in). The hotel also advertised free coffee and tea facilities in the rooms, which as it turned out had to be requested first. We did this soon after arrival, but were told they could not be delivered until the next morning--not very convenient if you stay for one day! Our bathroom had a very small shower area with one of those shower curtains that insists on clinging to you. Unfortunately this meant that even with a short shower the bathroom would be soaking wet, and we had to sacrifice two of our towels each day to make sure we could go to the toilet without getting wet feet. The wash basin in our bathroom was leaky, but this actually didn’t matter at all because we had to put towels there anyway because of the shower. This wetness was reflected in some moldiness between the tiles. On the other hand the cleaning staff (which did a fine job) did clean our room early each day, which confined the water problem to the mornings. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special. The room was quite busy and so was the staff, which did not appear to have time to actually notice any guests. Service at the reception desk, in contrast, was friendly albeit a bit cool. The reception area also features a small lounge, public toilets and a luggage storage space. Perhaps one of the most interesting services of the hotel is free access to a fitness center at the Karstadt across the road (though we did not use this). One thing to be aware of is that the hotel allows smoking in many of the rooms and in the common areas. Although you can request a non-smoking room when booking this is not guaranteed. Also, the hallways and elevators tend to smell like very well-used ashtrays. To summarize: Noisy location but easy access to the U-bahn. Good service, clean, but our bathroom was inconvenient and wet. Breakfast was adequate and hotel facilities were above average.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware before ordering”
Reviews.Author: Rejsende5487478
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now, since they won´t let us out of our four day-deal. We ordered it on the internet, but found out we would like to leave after two days. The staff wouldn´t under any circumstances let us out of the internet deal, even though we offered to pay for the most expensive days in the itinary etc. I have never experienced such an unflexible hotelpolitic. Un the ups are free acces to a really nice gym across the street, a great breakfeast, free newspapers, clean room, free internet, friendly staff sometimes and a great location. On the downside is that the rooms and the hotel in general is not cosy at all. You don´t feel like staying in the rooms which has terrible lightneing, old tvs and almost no decor at all. The same goes for the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rogertb
Reviews.Content: Just went to berlin for a 3 day visit, the hotel's a little away from the 'centre' but it was a good price (about £90/night inc. a very good breakfast) ... underground 2 minutes away ... and use of the local 'gym'.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, modern and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: williawebb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little out of town but this is good because you are so near to the underground (2 mins!) but you get more value for money! The hotel in modern with lots of modern art (some more interesting than others!). The rooms are spacious (including the singles) with lovely bathrooms with beautiful white towels, heating, air con and good upkeep. We asked for 2 rooms next to each other and although this was difficult, we got 2 rooms 3 doors apart. Much apprecitated from the hotel.The breakfast was in a lovely light room with a selection of tea, coffee, juice, cold meats and cheese, scrambled or boiled eggs and bread or toast. All buffet and you could sit as long as you liked (6.30am -10.30am). All free and easy to come and go as you please - rooms cleaned early and brilliantly! No restaurant for evening meals but look for a lunch meal in Alexanderplatz. The only disadvantage of the hotel were the pillows - we asked for 1 extra but they were still very flat and most uncomfortable which was a real shame. You can get a bus back to Scheonfeld airport no. 171 from outside the hotel. Allow an hour - the taxi was £30 if you take one on a Saturday night from the airport! Make sure you see the main sights - you can go on the tour bus with commentry - £20 each and hop on and off. See Checkpoint Charlie, bits of the Wall, DDR museum and Alexanderplatz. The catherdral is lovely from the outisde but expensive to go in - £7 each! We didn't! If you walk further on from the DDR museum you will find a shop with outside seating overlooking the river which sells snack and wraps. we sat outside one evening (blankets provided!) and watched the world go by. Enjoyed wonderful freshly made wraps and hot chocolate whilst sitting in deck chairs...!

Reviews.Title: “great location good value”
Reviews.Author: cactus52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the Sonnennalle ubahn stop. It is right across from a market with food stalls and fast food. Karlstadt dept store is nearby as well so you can get fruit etc in the basement of the dept store. The hotel has a nice breakfast room. You can use the gym on the top floor of the dept store. There is no internet there but there is an internet place nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CinziaItalia
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, maybe a little anonimous, nice staff, clean , wonderfull location for Ubahn and buses to airport and places of interest. Good breakfast. Great value for price. The only problem I had was the sleep quality due to traffic noise at night. Would undoubtedly return. Berlin is a modern, positive and ripe town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: marvellousmarvin
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear over New Year and it was a great base to explore Berlin. It's right next to the U-bahn Hermannplatz so all of Berlin is on your doorstep. Also the airport bus goes right to the hotel door which was handy. The immediate neighbourhood contains a few decent restaurants and there's a great kebab shop just across the road. Our room was spick and span with a lovely shower, decent beds (pillows a bit soft tho') and satellite tv with english news. The room was cleaned regularly and staff were polite and unobtrusive, allowing us to get on with our holiday. The breakfast buffet, on the top floor with a nice view over the city, had a good range and was nicely presented. I'd definitely go back. Not exactly characterful but clean, comfy and good value.

Reviews.Title: “standart best western quality”
Reviews.Author: ozzyUA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on may. the rooms were expensive because of the cup match between FC Bayern and werder bremen. the rooms were clean, breakfast was ok. i has really good location, close to the U-bahn (german metro). you can reach anywhere u want. there places to shop and eat around. staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Helmy7
Reviews.Content: We were travelling hotels and trying to limit our money spent. This hotel suited us perfectly. There was a bus from the airport that dropped us practically on the doorstep. A train line just outside that was easy to connect to where you wanted to go. Hotel was really nice for what you paid and we had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Sightseeing Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohnUk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times in the last few years whilst sightseeing around Berlin, and I think it is well-priced, clean and convenient. It is situated right on Hermannplatz (although the entrance is just round the corner in Sonnenallee). Hermannplatz has a U-Bahn station on lines U8 and U7, 1 minute from the hotel. The U8 takes you to Alexanderplatz in about 10 mins. The Bus service to Schonefeld airport also stops right outside the hotel entrance. The hotel rooms are clean and modern, with TV and minibar, and the breakfast buffet situated on the top floor is very good indeed. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there is a bar in the small reception area. The staff have always been very helpful. There is a good little Balkan restaurant directly opposite the hotel entrance in Sonnenallee, with an extensive menu (if you like meat), and a few cafes and the ubiquitous McD's in Hermannplatz, 1 min from the hotel. There are also a variety of other shops on Hermannplatz including a very big Karstadt, this branch being one of the oldest Dept stores in Berlin, with all you could need including an excellent foodhall in the basement. All in all a very sound little hotel with the benefit of being 1 minute from an U-Bahn station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price, no complaints whatsoever !”
Reviews.Author: parmo1
Reviews.Content: Not much to say really, everything went OK, quite friendly efficient checkin even though I arrived at midnight, however my “non smoking” room reaked of tobacco. The TV was quite small, but everything worked OK, the bedding was clean and fresh, as was the room. The “soap” in the bathroom was the liquid version in a squeezy container, which I don’t personally like, but it reduced the costs for the hotel , I suppose. The hotel is very near a U bahn station in the Turkish quarter of Neukoln, so lots of cheap and tasty kebabs 2 EUR 50c on average ! In the square there is a large department store, but it is not in the centre of Berlin ! For such a room, I think it was a bargain 50 EUR ! I was even surprised to find that it included breakfast, which was good, nice coffee, full strength orange juice, no complaints at all ! Bed was comfortable. 1 strange thing was one of the 2 lifts, it started only from the 1st floor not from ground floor ! So sometimes there was a 2 or 3 minute wait for the full lift to arrive. Yes , I thought that the quality/price was very very good at this hotel ! Even though it was a weekend and Berlin, which is a cheap city anyway

Reviews.Title: “Insects in room!!!”
Reviews.Author: neonn
Reviews.Content: I was forced to change the room in the middle of a night. It was totally disgusting experience. The other room was OK. but I felt uncomfortable anyway and decided to change the hotel next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEK2511
Reviews.Content: Reviewed the comments of hotels in Berlin and the Euro seemed to have a lot of positive comments so we opted for it. It was excatley as reviwers had said. The staff very friendly and the reception staff were particulary helpful. The hotel was very clean. The breakfast was excellant with a good choice. There was some comments about the noise but as it was winter and cold we did not need to open the windows and in fact spent quite a lot of time people watching out of our room window as we were on the front. The location is good, a little out of the centre but we enjoyed walking into the centre approx 3kms so very managable and caught the U bhan back which stops out side the hotel. We asked the reception staff for loca eating places and enjoyed a great Vietnamise meal. The resturant is small and busy and the table are set out in fours so you have to share a table. We found people very helpful as the English menu was not that easy to understand and the staff had limited english so other diners were helping us and advising us. The meal was 5 Euros so excellant value,very tasty and filling. We found most of the bars around the area had staff with little or no English but that added to the experience of the stay. On the whole we found the hotel very good value and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay -- Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tommypain
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights at a very reasonable rate. A very friendly front counter staff -- all who spoke English very well. They had good recommendations of local sights to see and places to eat. Very clean rooms. The included daily breakfast was incredible with many choices and much variety (rolls, meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurt, eggs, spreads and jams). One of our two room radiators didn’t work 100% and couldn’t get fixed on the weekend, but the repairman was there first thing Monday morning without having to be reminded. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel easy to get to from Tegel Airport”
Reviews.Author: lapetede
Reviews.Content: All other reviews mention other airports so I think this contributes to helping other tourists. As soon as you go out Tegel Airport there is a bus stop . You take the Bus X9 or 109 until Jakob-Kaiser-Platz, switch into the Underground, direction to Rudow and get off Hermannplatz. It will take about 35-40min. You have to take the Exit Urbanstrasse, not the one that says Hermannplatz. When you go up the first flight of stairs you will go from the U7 to the U8. When taking the second flight of stairs take the Urbanstrasse exit and you will see the hotel on the right side. On the left side there a Karstadt department store convenient for your shopping. You can buy a one-way-ticket for EUR 2,10 per person. You can also buy a daily ticket for EUR 6.20 easily in the information office in Hermannplatz below the stairs on the right side. If you have heavy bags you can take an elevator on the far side of Hermanplatz to get to the metro station. When you go back to the Airport you get off at Jakob-Kaiser Platz pay attention because you need to take the bus on the opposite street from where you took it coming in.

Reviews.Title: “Given the price it is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this Bestwestern hotel, and were triggered by the great offer of only 57 euros per room per night including breakfast! Different from other reviews, the airco worked perfectly well. The room was nice (large enough) and the bed was comfortable (we asked for a second pillow and had a perfect sleep). The bathroom was fine too; the shower pressure and temperature were OK except for 2 seconds in every minute when the cold water largely disappeared... (would this be very room specific...?) We had a daily repeating problem with the electronic key reader to enter the room but in the end the hotel staff solved it very professionally. The breakfast was convenient and even provided various sorts of tea and fresh fruits. Finally, the location. Well, the Hermannplatz it is not really the Kurfurstendam or Unter den Linden, but as all Berlin sights are scattered all over the city, the hotel is located rather centrally. Around KaDeWe or the Friedrichstrasse would be more central but probably also much more expensive. The Hermannplatz is quite busy with several streets intersecting, 2 subway lines, various bus stops, the large department store Karstadt, a McDonalds, several bars and small restaurants. From here, one can reach virtually each interesting place one needs to see in Berlin within one metro transfer. We found the extensive bus network also very useful. A tip: bus M29 (stops 10 meters from the hotel entrance) runs very frequently until 2:00 or so in the night to the giant KaDeWe department store, in 30 minutes; in the upper level of this double-decker bus you have a nice view. So, especially given the price, we would defnititely go to this hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: dylanw_uk
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! The breakfast was excellent, the room was clean and spacious, the staff were courteous and the transport links were great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service/excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennlonice
Reviews.Content: The service and cleanliness of this hotel couldn't have been better. The staff were superb and very helpful. The breakfast room on the top floor was an added treat-a huge assortment of various food which was constantly refilled and you can view the surrounding area (windows all around) as you drink your coffee. The metro is just across the street and very easy to use. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: CheshireCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in September 2007 and found it spotlessly clean, quite luxurious for the price, fairly modern and very comfortable indeed. We only had brief dealings with the receptionist but she was friendly and helpful. It was easy to travel to this hotel from Schonefeld airport thanks to the 171 bus which cost €2.10 each and ran straight from the airport to virtually outside the door of the hotel, although it is a long ride and takes about an hour. Buy your bus ticket from the machine outside the airport doors (and from the Hermannplatz station on the way back) and validate it by getting it punched in the machine on board the bus. This hotel is also ideally situated for the U-Bahn underground system, with Hermannplatz station right outside providing easy access to the whole city, with trains every few minutes. The breakfast was great with high quality food and drink, although we did catch the staff clearing away the buffet 10 minutes before it was supposed to end, which I think is unacceptable as there were still people walking in for breakfast, including us. There are plenty of kebab/pizza/noodle take-aways (and a McDonalds) right outside the hotel which offer food at twice the quality and half the price of equivalent places in Britain, and stay open till late. If you're happy to get by on take-away food in your hotel room, you can exist by spending next to nothing. There is a small shop a few doors away from the hotel, open until 2.00am and selling wine, beer, confectionery etc very cheaply - 500ml bottles of strong German lager straight from the fridge for €0.55 each! Overall this hotel is a good base if you want to explore Berlin for a couple of days, and I doubt you could find anything better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PeterB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient for Schoenefeld Airport, being at the terminus of the 171 bus which runs between Hermannplatz and the Airport. Takes about 50 minutes. The return stop is directly outside the hotel. It is situated alongside a busy main road intersection, but our room was on the 6th floor and we had no difficulty sleeping with the window closed. No air conditioning in the room but it was being installed and notices said would not be working until the end of September 2007. Otherwise the room was comfortable with satellite TV (BBC World and CNN in English), minibar and bright and clean bathroom with good shower. One drawback was that the beds had fairly thick down quilts which are quite hot at night, especially with the windows closed. We asked reception several times for thinner blankets, but our request seemed to get lost in translation and all we got sent were extra quilts! The breakfast room is also on the 6th floor with a glass roof and panoramic views across the roof tops and down the Kottbusser Damm. A good selection of meats, cheeses, scrambled egg, fruits etc available with fresh bread rolls and coffee jugs on the tables. Lots of small shops, cafes and restaurants on the Hermannplatz and streets around the hotel including a baker and large Karstadt department store across the road - handy for sandwiches and other supplies. The hotel reception helpfully provided a list of recommended restaurants nearby - we tried several and found them to be enjoyable and good value - particularly liked the Croatian and Egyptian ones. The U-bahn station on Hermannplatz is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel giving easy access to the rest of the city. Well worth a visit are the palaces and gardens at Chalottenberg and Potsdam, the superb museums on the Museum Island and the new Reichstag building (expect to queue for about an hour).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a package tour and were very pleased with the rooms and breakfast. Our corner room was located on a lower floor - right on a busy intersection - and it was simply not possible to leave the windows open at night - too noisy. The hotel is in the process of installing air conditioning - much needed! Beds were comfortable - though German pillows are an acquired taste for a North American! Large clean bathroom with ample towels and hair dryer. Built-in soap dispensers were a plus as we were travelling light. TV worked well with two English stations - CNN and BBC News. Fridge was nice too. The Karstadt across the street has an excellent food floor so we could buy food and store in the fridge for lunches. Room included wine glasses and Karstadt also has excellent wine/beer selection. Access to centre of city by bus or Ubahn - convenient and quite fast.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location, hot room”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here myself in June 2007 on a two day trip to Berlin. Hotel was clean, price was reasonable, location near Turkish area of Berlin interesting, with excellent shwarma near by, some of the best I ever tasted, at great prices. Although it is close to the subway (across the street), it is quite a distance by subway from the centre of the western part of the city (the Ku'Damm) although not too far from the Alexanderplatz in the eastern part. The hotel is not located in a touristy area. Staff was efficient, if not overly friendly. My one complaint is that I could not figure out the air conditioning in the room, and the room was hot, stuffy and smelly for lack of ventilation. Iam not sure that the hotel had air conditioning or internal ventilation at all. Then again, I could have asked for assistance, but did not. My room was a single and quite small. Decent breakfast served as part of the price, although when in Europe I prefer a quick espresso on the street rather than a sit down breakfast. A good place to stay on a budget. Not much in terms of facilities such as a gym, pool, etc, but the hotel does advertise that it is affiliated with a health club near by. Good neighborhood bar a few doors down, lots of locals hang out. Friendly clientele. Drink of preference definitely mixed drinks or beer, not white wine.

Reviews.Title: “Another good review!”
Reviews.Author: LCFC
Reviews.Content: I can't really understand how people can moan about this hotel! It is on a direct bus oute from Schonfeld,which is ideal when you arrive late at night.Bus 171 will get you to the hotel in about 45mins to an hour,all for 2.10 Euro's each! The Hotel is based in a predominantly Turkish area,and has very easy access to Hermanplatz U bahn.There are ecent eating places nearby(especially if you like Pizza,you can get decent ones for 3 euros!!!) there is even a subway and Mac Donalds if you are abit sad!!! The Hotel room was big BUT it faces a busy road which can have noise implications.If you have kids you may want a back room.When we were there it was HOT! There is no AC but we got fan and there's a mini bar with a good fridge.A shop nearby allows you to buy your own drinks and use the fridge!!! Breakfast was buffet style and was more than adequate and comprised of the usual Euro delights of breads,cheeses,meats,fruit,cereals,coffee and a nice touch of Earl Grey tea!!! Overall this may be a problem if you have kids and are facing the busy road,although the double glazing drowns out the noise,if its hot at night you wouldn't want the windows open and a fan might keep you awake.The location is ideal for travelling around and it is relativelt inexpensive. The staff were always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: ABPat
Reviews.Content: We found the Best Western Berlin a great hotel. Staff were freindly and spoke very good English and were more than helpful with any questions we had while we were staying there. The tube station into town is less than a minutes walk and only take 10 mins to get to any of the main attractions. Room was a good size, comfy bed and nice and clean. Only problem we had was that the shower in the bathroom was broken and kept hitting you in the head. Breakfast was really good, nice and fresh and plenty to be had. Hotel also provides car parking in a close parking lot that was nice and secure. Would recommend this to anyone going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK Adequate”
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Best Western Euro Hotel, Berlin. Rooms are spotless and cleaned daily. Good facilities - TV, Pay TV, Minibar, Fridge However, there is no air conditioning and the noise from the street below is unbearable. (Had to request a room to the back of the hotel having endured our first night with no sleep!!) Staff were obliging and spoke perfect English. The area of Berlin in which the Hotel is situated is not that attractive but as the Public Transport System is fantastic (on a par with the London Underground), it was fine. We felt safe at all times in the city. Berlin was a lovely city - a shopper's paradise with some lovely bars and restaurants - we were spoiled for choice. I definately would go back to Berlin but I wouldn't stay at the Best Western Euro Hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Bear Necessities of life!”
Reviews.Author: AYariv
Reviews.Content: The location is very good if you plan on using the public transportation: there is a bus stop right at the hotel door, that leads to the main shopping area (Ku'dam and KaDeWe), a very convenient Underground connection right across the street (U-7 and U-8 to Hermannplatz) and great transportation to all airports (to Schonefeld take line 171). The hotel itself is very un assuming, rooms are very basic without any luxuries, but the rate was very good, the breakfast buffet was rich and very good (3 different cheeses, about 6 different kind of cold meat, scrambled eggs and so on), and the hotel staff very pleasant and knowledgable. All in all, it is a very good choice for those who travel on a budget and for those looking for a place to crush at night. Amit.

Reviews.Title: “Euro Hotel is comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: zenobie
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It was comfortable, pleasant, convenient, and seemed to be meticululously well-run. I was travelling alone, and was given a single room of a reasonable size for one - not just a converted cupboard. The bed was comfortable and the shower/toilet was clean & attractive. I chose the hotel mainly because of its location : in Hermannplatz right at the terminus of the airport bus (No. 171) from Schonefeld Airport. That's very convenient - esp. when you arrive at around midnight, and are a bit wary of being ripped-off by taxis taking you across a huge & strange city. The city U-Bahn is literally just around the corner, and it took me straight to Alexanderplatz in c. 12 minutes. The bus stop (for other buses places in town e.g. Charlottenburg) is at the hotel front door. People in Berlin asked me: "Why are you staying all the way down there? That's not where tourists go." But I always said the location suited me fine. I never needed a taxi once: I always knew where I was going. The quality of the hotel was a pleasant surprise: the cold breakfast buffet was large, varied and very saitsfying - although the only hot dish was scrambled eggs ( but that's minor). It was lovely to eat breakfast on the top storey while looking out over the panorama of Berlin. I took my own electric kettle, coffee & milk powder with me, as the hotel didn't supply these for evening coffee in the bedroom. But they had complimentary coffee on offer in the foyer: you helped yourself as you wanted. I was even allowed free coffee after I had checked out and was waiting for the airport bus. Little things can mean a lot. I asked for 2 pillows instead of one, and got them. I was asked to pay a 50 Euro deposit for the mini-bar when I arrived. I said I wouldn't, because I had no intention of using it (I suspected having been ripped-off in other hotels) and I asked for it to be emptied straightaway. At midnight, the young receptionist didn't think he was allowed to do that: but the following evening when I returned, the minibar was empty and stayed empty all week. I liked that - getting what you ask for. I enjoyed my stay: the staff were pleasant & very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a Central Location at Hermannplatz. The train station is literally 1 minute walk away across the road. You are in the city centre in a matter of minutes. There is also a shopping centre next door for well priced food and gift shopping of all sorts. The breakfast on offer is a hot buffet style. Food was great no complaints at all. Our stay totalled 5 nights and would definitely go back. The area can be noisy and is not flash looking. Although our sleep was not disturbed and we felt safe at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking location and good safe area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our trip in Berlin and I would advise anyone to stop at this hotel! 30 min bus ride from the airport (number 171 bus) and has a tube station across the road to get into the centre in 5 mins (number U8 tube) Good safe streets and the local night life is good as well. Vist Mickey's Bar for a cheap fun night! 10 out of 10 for loaction and clean practical hotel rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel due to the pleasant and friendly service from staff, the hotel's location which is across the road from the underground and the Airport bus which stopped outside the hotel from both main airports. Our room was clean and spacious with room service everyday. Breakfast is a buffet which is quiet varied, although we did notice that staff did not replenished food so consequently guests who arrived later found that there was little choice. The hotel provided excellent information on tours and attractions and were very helpful in general. Overall, our opinion of this hotel is excellent and would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel that is good value and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from the Euro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average, as is the breakfast. It is across the street from an underground station, which is great. Also, a large department store is acorss the street, which is a nice feature. Rooms are maintained. However, the hotel has no air conditioning system, and we had to have the window open all night for circulation. The hotel sits on a very busy corner, and all night the sirens wailed, buses stopped for passengers directly under our window, and the traffic in general was very nosiy. If it had been another season, perhaps the noise would not have been an issue. The area of town is not the best, either. The staff was helpful, and that is much appreciated. We left from Tegel Airport, and you take one U train, then a bus, and you're there in about 45 minutes. Easy as pie.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Schoenefeld”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days in Berlin, staying at the Best Western Euro. My friends and I had one triple room (with one double & one single bed) and one single room between us. Both rooms were very clean (cleaned and towels changed every day) and the beds were very comfortable. We were on the sixth floor which helped reduce traffic noise, as the hotel's at a corner next to a crossroads with traffic lights. There's a phone, a minibar, TV and internet access. The restaurant on the top floor served an excellent breakfast every morning - it's a self service buffet with a large selection of breads, meat, cheese, eggs, yoghurts and drinks. The best thing about the hotel was the location. If you're coming from Schoenefeld you can get the 171 Airport bus to Hermannplatz (the last stop) for 2 Euros. It takes about an hour but it's also a regular bus service. There are a lot of people getting on and off - not the best if you have large suitcases. You could take the U-Bahn from Rudow station instead - It's about five mins from the airport in a taxi but there is also a station outside the airport. The hotel is right next to the Hermannplatz U-Bahn station. Buy a day ticket for 6 Euros (or a group ticket for up to five people for EUR15) and take advantage of Berlin's integrated subway system, you'll only have to wait 10 minutes at the most for a train. We had no problems getting around. The streets around the hotel are fine, we didn't feel unsafe at any time. There's a great Croatian restaurant about 2 minutes walk down the street and there's also a Lebanese one nearby. You're also close to a bakery, shops, bars and a McDonalds (if you really have to!). I would definately recommend the hotel. It was between this and the Abacus Tierpark when I was deciding but this hotel is better located for getting into the centre of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: lippi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Euro hotel for 4 nights and found it a wonderful base in Berlin. The underground is literally right across the street from the hotel, and from there you can easily get to anywhere in the city. The connection to and from Tegel (TXL) airport is easy and inexpensive. One subway ride (no transferring) and a short bus ride to the airport (included in the trip price). The room size was adequate, and the mattresses were extremely comfortable. One note, the rooms are not air conditioned, and if you open the windows, the traffic noise can be a bit loud. If that is not an issue for you then I would give this hotel an excellent rating. If that bothers you, I would look somewhere else. The breakfast was good, and was served in a beautiful room overlooking the city on the top floor. It feels like true luxury. The neighborhood is nice--not touristy, and feels comfortable to come back to each evening. There are some nice neighborhood restaurants around the area. It feels like the Berlin people live in, not the Berlin that only tourists visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if looking for good value all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thorchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November 2004, and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. The hotel is literally a stones throw from Hermanplatz U-Bahn station, and the Berlin U-Bahn/S-Bahn system is as good as the London Underground if not better. So even though it might look like the Hotel isn't in the centre of everything, don't worry because you can get anywhere you want on the trains. The Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, nightlife etc are all within easy reach, as is Shoenefeld Airport. The rooms are spaceous, clean and have everything you need, and if something isn't in the room chances are if you ring reception they will be able to help. The staff are all lovely and speak excellent English. Breakfast offers a massive choice and is served on the top floor. We paid £175 for the two of us for 3 nights which was really good value. I would definitely stay here again - it's not the Adlon, but for the money you pay you will be more than happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location if flying in through Schonefeld airport”
Reviews.Author: PLomond
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel, very clean and friendly. Good english spoken. Its ace feature is its location in the interesting suburb of Kreutzberg, on one corner of Hermanplatz where the 171 Schonefeld airport bus has its terminus so access from Schonefeld with luggage is logistically easy. From Hermanplatz there are two U-Bahn underground lines into the city centre - Alexanderplatz is only 10 minutes away. We paid Â 79 per room (March 2004) including a fabulous breakfast on top floor (6th) breakfast room which has spectacular views. Great value for money!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Euro-Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Sonnenallee 6, 12047 Berlin, Germany
